content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────
### Copper Cable Factory at (1.5, 19.5)
Consists of the production and transfer setup for copper-cable manufacturing:
• Input wooden chest at (2.5, 17.5)
• Burner inserter at (3.5, 17.5)
• Burner inserter at (2.5, 16.5)
• Burner inserter (with coal fuel) at (1.5, 17.5)
• Assembling machine (assembling-machine-1) at (1.5, 19.5)
• Output wooden chest at (1.5, 21.5)
• Additional burner inserter at (0.5, 21.5)

────────────────────
### Extraction System Belt Transport (Source and Depot)
Connects the extraction side to a dedicated belt depot:
• Extraction system burner inserter at (–3.5, 27.5) with drop position (–3.5, 28.5)
• Buffer wooden chest at (–3.5, 26.5)
• Defined intermediate waypoints at (0.0, 26.0) and (1.0, 22.0)
• Depot wooden chest (belt depot) at (3.5, 15.5)
• Dedicated transport belt segment at (4.5, 15.5)
• Depot burner inserter at (3.5, 14.5) with pickup position (3.5, 15.5)

────────────────────
### Electricity Generator at (–0.5, 24.5)
Provides power production through connected components:
• Boiler at (–5.5, 24.0)
• Offshore pump at (–7.5, 25.5)
• Burner inserter (supporting power-chain operations) at (–3.5, 23.5)
• Steam engine (generator) at (–0.5, 24.5)

────────────────────
### Smelting Facility at (–3.0, 19.0)
Processes raw materials via stone furnaces:
• Stone furnace at (–3.0, 19.0) (producing iron-plate)
• Stone furnace at (–4.0, 21.0) (producing copper-plate)
• Wooden chest at (–4.5, 18.5)
• Wooden chest at (–5.5, 21.5)

────────────────────
### Research Lab
Consists of:
• Lab (electrical_id: 7106) configured with science-pack input  
  (Note: Position not specified)

ERROR TIPS
────────────────────
• Errors connecting transport belts to an incorrect target  
  – When attempting multi‐segment belt connections, the target was misinterpreted as a steam engine. Always ensure the belt connects to an inserter that feeds the steam engine rather than the engine itself.

• Errors placing wooden chests due to placement range and inventory issues  
  – Ensure the player is within the maximum placement distance of the target position before attempting placement and verify that the required item (e.g. wooden chest) is available in inventory.

• Undefined variable errors  
  – Confirm that all variables are properly defined and consistently referenced (for example, use the correct variable name such as “depot_chest” instead of an undefined “target_chest”).
